question:
Simplify $\sin 17^\circ + \sin 43^\circ.$

Enter your answer as a trigonometric function evaluated at an integer, such as "sin 7".  (The system will assume that the angle is in degrees.  The angle should be positive and as small as possible.)
agents_response:
We can use the sum-to-product identities to simplify this expression.

$\sin 17^\circ + \sin 43^\circ = 2 \sin \left( \frac{17^\circ + 43^\circ}{2} \right) \cos \left( \frac{43^\circ - 17^\circ}{2} \right)$

$= 2 \sin 30^\circ \cos 13^\circ$

$= 2 \left( \frac{1}{2} \right) \cos 13^\circ$

$= \cos 13^\circ$

$\boxed{\cos 13}$
